org.forgerock.json.ref.jackson

Class JacksonReferenceTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.json.ref.JsonReferenceTransformer
      • org.forgerock.json.ref.jackson.JacksonReferenceTransformer

  • public class JacksonReferenceTransformer
extends JsonReferenceTransformer
    Resolves JSON reference values using the Jackson JSON processor, converting from JSON representations to standard Java objects. This transformer applies its transformation for http(s) and file URL schemes, or associated relative URIs. Any other URIs are ignored.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.forgerock.json.ref.JsonReferenceTransformer

    • Constructor Detail

      • JacksonReferenceTransformer

        public JacksonReferenceTransformer(URI base,
                                   JsonValue root)
                            throws JsonReferenceException
        Constructs a new Jackson JSON reference transformer.
        Parameters:
        base - the base URI of the referring document.
        root - the root value of the referring document.
        Throws:
        JsonReferenceException - if base is not null and is not an absolute URI.

    • Method Detail

      • isResolvable

        protected boolean isResolvable(URI uri)
        Description copied from class: JsonReferenceTransformer
        Returns true if the specified URI can be resolved by this transformer.

        The default implementation returns false. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses that can resolve particular types of URIs.

        Overrides:
        isResolvable in class JsonReferenceTransformer
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to test to determine if it can be resolved.
        Returns:
        true if the specified URI can be resolved by this transformer.

      • resolve

        protected JsonValue resolve(URI uri)
                     throws JsonException
        Description copied from class: JsonReferenceTransformer
        Resolves the specified URI into a JSON value. The URI is guaranteed to not contain a fragment identifier.

        The default implementation throws a JsonException. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses that can resolve particular types of URIs.

        Overrides:
        resolve in class JsonReferenceTransformer
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to resolve.
        Returns:
        the JSON value that the URI resolves to.
        Throws:
        JsonException - if the URI could not be resolved.
